attributes.action: Prevent the rise in tuition fees under the TEF for university students
attributes.background: The TEF is the teaching excellence framework, an idea which in itself is not necessarily negative and will attempt to bring universities to a similar standard however the rise in fees associated with the cash incentives, some universities would see a steady increase in already climbing tuition fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.savethestudent.org/news/whats-the-deal-with-the-tef.html

attributes.action: Anyone fly-tipping should lose their driving licence and have vehicle crushed
attributes.background: We live in a beautiful country and it's disgraceful to see people getting away with fly-tipping. Instead of fines if there is evidence from the public filming the offence then crush the offending vehicle and ensure the driver is banned from driving, and give them a community order to clear rubbish.

attributes.action: Government has to replace EU funding for rare diseases
attributes.background: There are over 6000 rare diseases that Rare Disease Day recognise that need ongoing research and funding. By leaving the EU I wish to ensure that the funding remains in place. My son has PVNS which needs continued funding.
attributes.additional_details: http://ec.europa.eu/research/health/pdf/ri_projects_factsheet.pdf#view=fit&pagemode=none

attributes.action: Back the British Pound with gold and / or silver.
attributes.background:
Many people are alarmed at the voracious rate of money printing or QE here in the UK (& elsewhere). This is nothing more than a ponzi scheme & this one will end in disaster soon.
We need to get ahead of the game & back our currency with gold/silver before others steal the lead on this.
attributes.additional_details:
Web. www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Web. www.sprott.com
Book. When Money Dies. Adam Ferguson.
Book. The Silver Manifesto. David Morgan.
Book. The Big Reset. Willem Middelkoop
Organisation. GATA (Gold Anti Trust Action Committee)

attributes.action: Create ban for 5.5+ tonne lorries using the outside lane on dual lane motorways
attributes.background: Create enforceable ban on lorries 5.5 tonnes and over using the outside lane on dual lane motorways, to be especially strict during heavy commuting hours. It causes a huge risk to public safety with exaggerated accordion effects and shunt crashes due to high closing speeds. Also slows down traffic!
attributes.additional_details: The M42 is a good example. Between the M6 at Birmingham and the M1 south, lorries pull out whenever they please causing massive queues and shunt crashes during 'rush hour' times. This needs to stop!

attributes.action: S106 money for sport equally divided; mens, womans and childrens involvement.
attributes.background: Funding for sport through Section 106 can disproportionately advance male dominated sports and not benefit the whole community. This money should be used to support women and children to access sports also and any money used must show how it can equally support sport for all.

attributes.action: Change lottery back to £1 and 49 balls also the operator Camelot has ruined it
attributes.background: Since lottery was changed your chances of winning are 45 million to 1 rather 14 million to 1 also  the doubling off the price and cutting the amount off 20,000 raffles down from 50 off  to 20 off and the prize fund needs look at example when you got 5 numbers and only got £15 and 3 numbers got £25
attributes.additional_details:
The odds of winning the lottery with 59 numbers
 the new rules, the pool of numbers for players to choose from will increase from 49 to 59. At the moment, players choose six numbers up to 49, with odds of winning the jackpot sitting at just under one in 14 million. These will lengthen to around one in 45 million from Saturday
Punters with five winning numbers in Wednesday's Lotto draw ended up with just £15.

attributes.action: Eliminate higher rate stamp duty for small developers restoring  old properties
attributes.background: Currently buying and restoring an unihabitable Victorian house previously owned by elderly people who did not look after it. Will then sell it as an updated habitable property. Would pay stamp duty anyway as well as vat on costs of restoring and tax on completion. Higher rate sdlt too much.
attributes.additional_details: Higher rate stamp duty is an unnecessary tax preventing developers updating and restoring homes. Can make the process unviable. We will end up having derelict properties dotted around our towns and cities which could be homes.

attributes.action: Help fix the broken NHS with proper funding from increased NI contributions
attributes.background:
The NHS has funding issues and needs help immediately.
1. I would agree to a small increase in my national insurance contributions to help fix the ailing service
2. NI contributions to be ring fenced for the NHS only
3. An independent governing body to run the NHS and to control these funds

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for theft of tools from vans and  people that sell them
attributes.background: After having my vehicle broke into twice in the same amount of weeks I think it's about time the government did something to deter these thieves

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Fat Tax' on foods to help beat the obesity crisis.
attributes.background:
Too often in stores youll find unhealthy foods tend to be cheaper, or on offer more often than healthier options. High streets are lined with fast food stores, which deliver cheap & quick option for individuals.
Introducing a fat tax will make healthier options more viable for individuals.

attributes.action: Make Social Services & Cafcas accountable & transparent by using audio recording
attributes.background: Social Services & Cafcas get it wrong too much. Innocent families have children removed and families needing intervention go ignored. Errors are made in the reports and systems. Interviews not accurately relayed and misinterpreted. They need to be held to account and interviews audio recorded.
attributes.additional_details: Social Services fabricated evidence in my social chronology, misinterpreted information and made duplicate entries without changing dates so it's obvious the errors. Biased opinions are relied on and facts and evidence presented ignored so we are unable to address these. Complaints are passed to nhs and back to Ss. Theses incorrect opinions and documents are relied on. Making complaints is used against us. Cafcas & Social Services also record opinions and misconstrue interview content.

attributes.action: For the PM to notify the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25 March 2017
attributes.background: The people of the UK voted on 23rd June 2017 to leave the EU. The bill to withdraw is currently passing through Parliament. Once passed, it would be fitting for the Prime Minister to notify, under Article 50(2) of the Treaty on EU, the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25th March 2017.

attributes.action: Start a new online lottery to fund the National Health Service in the UK
attributes.background: Due to the disastrous state that the National Health Service finds itself in today it is essential that extra funding is found. The Health Lottery only funds local issues, a new National Lottery for this purpose would seem ideal.

attributes.action: Allow people to invest their Pension Funds in residential property.
attributes.background: Currently people who have SIPPS and SSAS Pension Funds are prohibited from investing in residential property and can only invest in commercial. Allowing residential property purchase would unlock investment in rental housing which would then overtime reduce the cost of rental property.
attributes.additional_details:
It is acknowledged the concerns about pension funds purchasing the homes of scheme members and we therefore accept the need for regulations to prevent this.
However, the unintended consequences of the way that the current regulations are drafted is that the sector is potentially being deprived of significant and stable investment. Investors are instead being driven to potentially more risky buy-to-let investments, or not into housing at all.

attributes.action: Protect all natural physical and mental characteristics under the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Today's society and cultural norms are swarmed by double standards. It is a criminal offence to discriminate somebody due to their ethnic origin, sex etc, but it is socially acceptable to discriminate somebody because of their hair colour, height and other genetic traits. In 2017, this has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In a developed nation, you would expect all kinds of discrimination to have been abolished. Only decades ago it was both legally and socially acceptable to mock and discriminate someone due to their sexual orientation. It is only recently that society and the government have start to come to it's senses and understand discrimination's devastating consequences. This must be applicable to all, so everyone can feel accepted and valued without having to battle unnecessary judgement and insecurity.

attributes.action: Establish a mandatory retirement age of 2 years for UK Beagles in Animal Testing
attributes.background: Beagles one of the most intelligent loving dogs around  were forced to inhale cigarette smoke in the 70s and in labs are still subjected to live in tiny cages and forced to inhale weed- killers, pesticides and other toxic substances. In California a bill has been passed and can the UK do the same?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/476866/WATCH-Freed-beagles-play-outside-for-the-first-time

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/news/bill-that-requires-labs-to-retire-cats-and-dogs-from-testing-passed-in-california/

attributes.action: Enforce Big Pharma to contribute N% of annual profits to Mental Health in U.K.
attributes.background:
As a young person with a history of mental health difficulties I know just how hard it is to receive the quality treatment from the NHS I need to make a strong sustainable recovery.  

With government cuts abound, it is well overdue for the industry benefiting from the rise in diagnoses to pay up!
attributes.additional_details:
We are facing an unprecedented level of mental health crises in the U.K. 

With an ever growing demand for hospital beds and meds, we need a rapid and concerted effort from industry, government and charity to reduce the level of serious incidents and proactively 'maintain', not 'manage' the nations mental health. 

This will be only be achieved through new innovative legislature which targets the unrivalled profits from pharmaceutical companies and rebalances their private corpate interests.

attributes.action: Create public bonds that pension funds etc' can invest to build owned homes too.
attributes.background: The recent addition of bonds to enable buy-to-let creation doesn't help facilitate a proper meritocracy. More proper for a 50-50 split in terms of building policy choice. This policy seems like a government giving up on the future of truly independent living to appease the big house builders.
attributes.additional_details: We know that the big 5 housing companies are holding onto roughly 476,000 planning permissions, artificially inflating housing prices and have been doing so for decades. I say this policy is just as monopolistic in tendency as the recent energy, rail ticketing and Fifa bribes scandals. This isn't about morals, this is about conservative Hayek based free-market systems. Unfortunately, a state sponsored 'eye' is required to help maintain proper market function from time to time.

attributes.action: Abolish all speed limits on the M6 toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is a private road and road users have to pay to use it. The police should have no authority to generate funds from drivers who ignore the 70mph limit as hello this is a private road.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of local phone numbers to National or non local businesses.
attributes.background: People are being deceived into thinking they're calling a local tradesperson because they call a local number in their local paper, when in reality they are being diverted elsewhere without knowing it.
attributes.additional_details: Recently an 82 year old woman called what she thought was a friendly neighbourhood business and ended up getting ripped off to the tune of £138 and the company which was over 200 miles away refused to put it right, this is one of many examples of this.

attributes.action: Make compulsory all councils collect the same waste & recycling in the same bins
attributes.background: All areas across the UK collect different waste and recycling in different bins. It is confusing for all not knowing what waste and recycling to put in which bin.  If the same things can be recycled in the same bins it would reduce confusion, increase recycling rates and reduce contamination.

attributes.action: Wages to be tax free for 1 month every year.
attributes.background: I earn an average wage and when it comes to pay day I still struggle with outgoings especially around Christmas time. I always find myself looking at my pay slip wishing that I could have 100% of the money that I worked hard to make, this is one of many reasons why I have started this petition.
attributes.additional_details: The average salary for 2016/17 in the UK is around £28,000, the person earning this salary will only see around £22,000 of it. To some people this may or may not be a lot of money but regardless of whether you think it is or not, that person worked hard to earn this money. Our contributions are not voluntary but they make a very big difference to our country which is why I believe we deserve at least 1 month in a year where our wages is tax free.

attributes.action: Lower  the pension  age to 60  for disabled people
attributes.background: Why make the disable  wait for there pension  until there 65/66  they should have a choice  to retire at 60 or wait until they are 65/66

attributes.action: Make apprenticeships available to people from the age of 12
attributes.background: School doesn't work for everyone. However it might be beneficial for some people to learn in different ways through an apprenticeship. This might help young people with autism or other similar needs who want to learn but can't be in school.

attributes.action: no matter what time in the pregnancy women should be allowed a death certificate
attributes.background: I was 11 weeks pregnant and had a miscarriage it was a horrible experience and not being allowed a death certificate made it a lot harder to cope it makes us feel as though your baby didn't exist when they did a death certificate after a miscarriage any time in the pregnancy should be allowed.
attributes.additional_details: A death certificate is a coping method as well used making it feel like you're baby did exist but not long enough for a birth certificate all couples should be allowed one as a way of coping and feeling like their baby was there.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from party politics
attributes.background: Remove the NHS from party politics. Consider an option similar to an independent non-political NHS committee that will be responsible for the budget and running of the NHS. Often the NHS is a political football and used to gain seats in elections. It needs to be run independently outside of politics
attributes.additional_details: When it comes to the day-to-day running of the NHS, the role of national politics should be significantly reduced.

attributes.action: Force large landowners to increase afforestation to stop flooding downstream
attributes.background: The risk of flooding in lowland areas is currently been increased by large landowners increasing the level of drainage and not increasing the percentage of land covered by woodland. Increases in woodland would both reduce the speed and  water levels reaching watercourses and preventing flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Flooding in low lying areas is caused by four main factors: precipitation levels, level of development on floodplains, speed of water reaching local watercourses and amount reaching watercourses. This petition is trying to encourage legislation in two of these four factors: speed and amount of water reaching local watercourses. Watersheds need vast increases in woodland to slow down water speeds through the leaves of trees, soil saturation and vegetation using water resources.

attributes.action: Stop GM wheat planting in the UK!
attributes.background: The Government has given permission for GM wheat crops to be tested again in the UK.  The last time they tried this, it did not work and cost the public £3m.  Birds will pick ears and drop them in non-GM fields, which will make normal wheat infertile and will seriously affect organic farms.
attributes.additional_details: The Soil Association, GM Freeze (an association of over 30 organisations) and most UK farmers are totally against GM crops. There is no way to confine this to the planting area, as has been proved in the US and most US farmers have stopped planting this as consumers didn't want it.

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Use 2% of the UK's budget to help aid refugees affected by the Syrian war.
attributes.background: Currently, the Syrian war is forcing millions of refugees to flee to Europe for aid. I believe that if we are to become a peaceful world and allow society to advance in a prosperous way, we need to stop allowing stereotypical racism and fear to kill millions of suffering people.
attributes.additional_details: They are not here to steal jobs they want to be back in Syria but it's too unsafe. We need to make the country understand that these are people! Not statistics or terrorists! Just imagine if we were in the same situation.

attributes.action: Make contents insurance mandatory for all council tenants
attributes.background:
We live in a semi detached house which we own.  This is an ex council house. The house that we are attached to is still owned by the Council.

As we have a morgage we have to take out building and contents insurance. 

But if you are a council Tennant you don't have to have insurance of any kind
attributes.additional_details:
The house next door had a very sevier fire and we have been out of our house for a long time

Our insurance covered us for our damage but as there is not any insurance with the next door property our insurance premium will go up

I was not aware that insurance is optional if you are a council tenant and even though none of this is our fault we are the ones left paying the price

Thing's  need to change and I don't think it's too much to ask a council tenant to take responsibility for themselves

attributes.action: Add 1p tax on all cartons/bottles/packet sold - money used to clean our streets
attributes.background: Our cities are getting filthier because of the litter, even our countryside is now suffering badly. Councils find it ever harder to deal with this issue with budgetary restraints, particularly in rural areas. Adding 1p to an item will not add much to its cost but could have a very positive effect.
attributes.additional_details: I recently walked two miles of a country lane and collected 28 black bags of plastic and cans! We are sinking in rubbish. A 1p levy on each item (multi packs - 12 pack would pay 12p more) would raise a huge amount of money and could be granted to local councils 'ring fenced' to pay for new employees to clean up the problem.

attributes.action: Introduce Targeted Sanctions and Travel bans on President Trump and Inner Circle
attributes.background: President Donald Trump is breaching the US constitution, ignoring judicial orders breaking international law and separating families with his executive order revoking visas and has fired the acting Attorney General for refusing to defend an unconstitutional position.
attributes.additional_details:
Targeted sanctions similar to those applied to senior Russian leaders can be used to pressure US leadership to return from the brink of fascism before it is too late. It is important to stand early against tyrants before they can remove democratic checks and balances and the UK needs a democratic USA as ally.

People included in the sanctions should at least include the President, his children, VP, Steven Bannon, the US Cabinet and nominees and the immediate families of all those mentioned.

attributes.action: A child born of British parent(s) shall not require a visa to enter/live in UK.
attributes.background: In line with the Human Rights of Children.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to stop children going to the toilet at school
attributes.background:
At school children are constantly told they cannot go to the toilet.
Going to the toilet is a basic human right and should not be taken away from you at school.

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: We should adapt to the same laws Canada has on young relationships
attributes.background: Many teenagers today are tried and parents try to prosecute other kids for simply dating there child even if there 1/2-years younger. We should adapt to the same laws Canada has in this field by making it so you can date anyone within a 3-year age gap if one is over 16 and one is under 16.
attributes.additional_details:
Also don't get me wrong I'm not saying have sex that should remain illegal till there 16, but kissing/cuddling etc is considered sexual contact and I think the law should be changed to prevent innocent people being prosecuted for that.

No 16-year old should be given a trial for dating someone 1-year younger when we have a older generation some with 20-year age gaps and then be quick to judge a small age gap

We need to protect children and focus on what the law was made for. Predatory Old men.

attributes.action: England should be given a referendum on leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

attributes.action: Urge people to NOT book to go on holiday in the USA until Trump leaves office.
attributes.background: Since Trump wants to exclude certain people based solely on their religion and where they're from, and not because they committed an offence, I think we should show support by choosing not to visit the USA simply to go on holiday. I'd say especially stay away from Trump Hotels.

attributes.action: Ban all political parties from putting election boards on lamp posts through NI
attributes.background: Are you sick of seeing election boards on lamp posts/telegraph poles throughout Northern Ireland every time there is an election of some kind? Would you like to see the money they waste better spent ? If so, please sign this petition and get it banned .

attributes.action: Make teachers shouting at students a criminal offence
attributes.background: After finding it rather upsetting and difficult after having being shouted at by a teacher and seeing no purpose in this form of abuse , I feel that rules need to be put in place to Stop the Shouting.

attributes.action: A real Home automatically for every Ex Servicemen.
attributes.background: Servicemen are being discharged to find themselves on the streets. Having to live on the streets and beg to survive. They have served their country and our country needs to show respect for them.......
attributes.additional_details: Everyday housing is given to immigrants who have never contributed to our country either through taxes or national insurance. Yet our servicemen are being treated like 2nd class citizens having to sleep on the streets and beg .......

attributes.action: Introduce stricter air pollution laws in the uk eg. stronger fines.
attributes.background: This year 24 areas in London reached the highest recorded levels of pollution in 5 years. This also happened in several areas in Western Europe effecting people with breathing disabilities. We need to lead in environmental issues as we have great influence. This will prompt other countries to follow
attributes.additional_details: The information is a reference to the observers article on pollution, published on the 29th January 2017 (Sunday) titled: Smog In the cities: the truth about Britain's dirty air.

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.

attributes.action: More Financial transparency for care leavers going into higher education.
attributes.background: Care leavers that come from disadvantaged backgrounds should be given total transparency over what actual support is available to them when accessing higher education. More fincial support should be offered as student loans at 7k per year is not enough specially when not at uni in the summer time.

attributes.action: Mersey Tunnel Bill to be repealed so that its provisions no longer apply.
attributes.background: The provision of the Bill has a negative effect on the economy of the North West of England.

attributes.action: Abolish the 5% VAT on children's car seats
attributes.background: Currently, the VAT on children’s car seats is at the reduced rate of 5%. However, by law children must use a car seat until they’re 12 years old or 135 centimetres tall (whichever comes first).
attributes.additional_details: It seems ridiculous to apply VAT to something when doing so could potentially result in parents compromising on their child's safety. If children's clothing is zero-rated then car seats for children and babies should be too.
